uk.co.nationalrail.xml.incident.PtIncide.ns3:Summary: Disruption between Leeds and Doncaster / Sheffield expected until 13:00
uk.co.nationalrail.xml.incident.PtIncide.ns3:Description:
All lines have now reopened between Wakefield and Doncaster following damage to the overhead electric wires near Fitzwilliam yesterday.

Emergency engineering works took place this morning to fix the overhead electrical wires.

Trains running between Leeds and Doncaster, and between Leeds and Moorthorpe may still be disrupted until 13:00.

LNER

LNER services are no longer being diverted and can now stop at Wakefield Westgate 

Northern

The following services are now expected to run in full -

  • 10.20 Leeds - Doncaster
  • 09.25 Doncaster - Leeds
  • 11.25 Doncaster - Leeds

 

Due to the line given back at short notice the Leeds - Sheffield via Moorthorpe services will still operate with road replacement vehicles as follows-

  • 09.15 Wakefield - Moorthorpe (and set down as required to Sheffield - passengers at Leeds to board 08.52 Leeds - Knottingley and change at Wakefield Westgate for this road replacement)
  • 10.31 Leeds - Moorthorpe (and set down as required to Sheffield)

 

A road replacement service will also operate between Moorthorpe and Leeds calling at all stations in between at the following times -

09:10, 10:20, 11:10, 12:15.

Trains services are able to operate between Sheffield and Moorthorpe as booked departure times.

The route from Leeds to Sheffield via Barnsley will operate as normal.

 

East Midlands Trains

The 09:50 Leeds to London St Pancras International service will start from Nottingham.

The 10:50 Leeds to London St Pancras International service will now run as normal, calling at Wakefield Westgate.

Check before you travel:
You can check your journey using the National Rail Enquiries real-time Journey Planner

You can find the location of your bus replacement by checking station signs or by searching for your station on our station information pages

Twitter:
If you would like to follow this incident on Twitter, please use #Fitzwilliam

Compensation:
You may be entitled to compensation if you experience a delay in completing your journey today. Please keep your train ticket and make a note of your journey, as both will be required to support any claim.

Feedback:
We want to make information better - tell us how! Fill out this online Disruption Survey.

ns3:Affects.ns3:RoutesAffected:
East Midlands Trains between Leeds and London St Pancras International

LNER between Leeds and London Kings Cross

Northern between Leeds and Doncaster / Sheffield (via Moorthorpe)
